result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric A Ivory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders bail on this case to apply towards restitution ordered in case 14CF793. The Court orders the balance of the bail held pending restitution hearing in case 14CF793 on 1-21-15. The Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Pay all supervision fees. 
Provide DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Pay all applicbale mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs - bail to apply after restitution on case 14CF793 paid in full from bail.
Concurrent with: To case 14CF793, consecutive to any other time, with credit for 55 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain part time employment.
Participate in vocational training.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Sec. 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions; Firearm possession and Voting.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Sam's Club located at 1540 S. 108th St., West Allis
No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).

Take any prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in Cognitive thinking.

Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Cooperate with random urine screens.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for sentencing in Count 1.
